DataElement.preferredName: The Cancer Human Biobank Pathologist Case Summary Report Submission Person Name
DataElement.preferredDefinition: The name of the caHUB pathologist that submitted the Case Summary Report.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: The Cancer Human Biobank Pathologist Case Summary Report Submission
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A derived program of the National Cancer Institute's Biorepositories and Biospecimen Research Branch (NCI BBRB) that carries out specialized biospecimen and data procurements to support biospecimen science activities. The caHUB network consists of Biospecimen Source Sites (BSSs), The Comprehensive Biospecimen Resource (CBR), The Comprehensive Data Resource (CDR), The Pathology Resource Center (PRC), and Molecular Analysis Facilities (MAFs)._Pathologist is a doctor specialized in medical diagnosis based on the macroscopic and microscopic study of structural changes of tissues and organs caused by the disease._A problem requiring investigation._A shortened version of a speech or written text, containing only the main points._A short textual account; having provided a short account._Something submitted for the judgment or consideration of others.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A derived program of the National Cancer Institute's Biorepositories and Biospecimen Research Branch (NCI BBRB) that carries out specialized biospecimen and data procurements to support biospecimen science activities. The caHUB network consists of Biospecimen Source Sites (BSSs), The Comprehensive Biospecimen Resource (CBR), The Comprehensive Data Resource (CDR), The Pathology Resource Center (PRC), and Molecular Analysis Facilities (MAFs).:Pathologist is a doctor specialized in medical diagnosis based on the macroscopic and microscopic study of structural changes of tissues and organs caused by the disease.

Concepts.definition: A derived program of the National Cancer Institute's Biorepositories and Biospecimen Research Branch (NCI BBRB) that carries out specialized biospecimen and data procurements to support biospecimen science activities. The caHUB network consists of Biospecimen Source Sites (BSSs), The Comprehensive Biospecimen Resource (CBR), The Comprehensive Data Resource (CDR), The Pathology Resource Center (PRC), and Molecular Analysis Facilities (MAFs).
Any physician whose career is devoted to the study of pathology.
